title: Shares of several hotels, restaurants & leisure companies are trading lower as equities sell off following the recent rally. Stocks have rallied over the past week amid optimism towards the US economy reopening and investors have potentially taken some profits following the run up. NOTE: Investors are awaiting the FOMC meeting on Wednesday.
20 Consumer Cyclical Stocks Moving In Tuesday's Pre-Market Session
Shares of several hotels, resorts, and leisure companies are trading higher on continued optimism amid the reopening of the economy, which would increase consumer spending and economic activity.
Shares of several hotels, restaurants & leisure companies are trading higher following strong US jobs data and continued optimism amid the reopening of the economy.
Ruth's Hospitality Group Inc Did Experience Beef Inflation In May 2020 And Currently Expects Continued Inflation In June 2020; Also Says As Of June 1, 2020, Company Had A Cash Balance Of $102.8M

Shares of several companies in the broader consumer discretionary space are trading higher as markets continue to gain on optimism over an economic reopening as well as a smaller-than-expected drop in nonfarm payrolls. The economy reopening could mean more consumer spending which is good for the sector.
